title: In Situ Microneedle Insertion Mechanics into an SEM-Compatible Artificial Mechanical Skin Model
content: Microneedles are an emerging technique for drug delivery and electrochemical biosensing due to their low cost, painless application, and low risk for permanent harm to human skin. Much work has been done regarding drug delivery potential and electrochemical biosensing efficacy of microneedles. However, the mechanics of microneedle insertion in skin is a less studied area, particularly at high imaging resolutions. In this work, we have developed a simple approach for studying microneedle insertion mechanics with an SEM-compatible artificial mechanical skin model.
